explanations: For group 1 ます-form verbs, drop ます, change the last syllable from the い-column to the え-column and add ば
examples: 1) かきます → かけば
1) To write
2) よみます → よめば
2) To read
3) いそぎます → いそげば
3) To hurry
4) あそびます → あそべば
4) To play

explanations: For group 2 ます-form verbs, attach れば to ます-form
examples: 1) たべます → たべれば
1) To eat
2) みます → みれば
2) To see

explanations: From group 3 ます-form verbs, if します, becomes すれば
From group 3 ます-form verbs, if きます, becomes くれば
examples: 1) します → すれば
1) To do
2) きます → くれば
2) To come

explanations: Add なければ to the ない-form
examples: 1) いかない → いかなければ
1) To not go
1) いかない → いかなければ
1) To not go

explanations: Change the い to ければ
Delete the な to なら

topic: Conditional form use: Preconditions for main clause
explanations: Expressing something as a precondition for what is expresses in the following (main) clause to happen
[Note] As a rule, intention, hopes, orders, requests, etc only appear in the following (main) clause, when the subjects of the predecing and following clauses are different as in 2)
[Note] Or when the predicate of the preceding clause is conditional as in 3)
examples: 1) ボタンを 押[お]せば，窓[まど]が 開[あ]きます。
1) If you press the button, the window will open
2) 彼[かれ]が 行[い]けば，私[わたし]も 行[い]きます。
2) If he goes, I will go too
3) 明日[あした] 都[つ]合[ごう]が よければ，来[き]て ください。
3) If its convenient for you, please come tomorrow
4) いい 天[てん]気[き]なら，向[む]こうに 島[しま]が 見[み]えます。
4) When the weather's fine, you can see an island over there

topic: Conditional form use: Response to words or explanation
explanations: Responsing to what someone has said or to an explanation of the situation
[Note] As a rule, intention, hopes, orders, requests, etc only appear in the following (main) clause, when the subjects of the predecing and following clauses are different
[Note] Or when the predicate of the preceding clause is conditional as in 1)
examples: 1) ボールペンが ないんですが。
1) I dont have a ballpoint pen
1) ... ボールペンが なければ，鉛[えん]筆[ぴつ]で 書[か]いて ください。
1) ... If you dont have a ballpoint pen, please write in pencil
2) 明日[あした]までに レポートを 出[だ]さなければ なりませんか。
2) Do I have to hand in the report by tomorrow?
2) ... 無[む]理[り]なら，金[きん]曜[よう]日[び]までに 出[だ]して ください。
2) ... If thats too difficult, please hand it in by Friday

topic: Interrogative V conditional form いいですか
explanations: This is the expression used when asking the listener for advice or instructions
If can be used in the same way as ~たら いいですか, introduced in Lesson 26
examples: 1) 本[ほん]を 借[か]りたいですが，どう すれば いいですか。
